lead_paragraph: Mergers and acquisitions bankers and lawyers pegged the decline to concerns about antitrust regulation, the United States presidential election and last week’s Brexit vote.

headline.print_headline: Slowdown in Mergers and Acquisitions Deals Pegged to Political Uncertainty
headline.main: Slowdown in Merger Deals Attributed to Political Uncertainty

snippet: Mergers and acquisitions bankers and lawyers pegged the decline to concerns about antitrust regulation, the United States presidential election and last week’s Brexit vote....
abstract: Data compiled by Thomson Reuters reveals $1.6 trillion worth of deals have been announced so far in 2016, marked 19 percent drop from similar period in year earlier; drop in number of mergers and other deals is indication of uncertainty.
